txt.en: Return to Elain on the path to the Watchtower

'The leader of this band has taken up residence within the watch-tower. With them peering out over all the lands from such a high point, we cannot hope to secure Trum Dreng once more without a full army. Alas that my peoples have grown so few and weak.\n\n'But there is still hope, [placeholder]. If we can cut our way through to the tower, we can surely call Murig down from high. He will surely think that a commotion at the door will be his own folk making the noise. He will come down, I think, and we can defeat him on the ground.'

'You have done better than I could have hoped to do myself, [placeholder]; the watch-tower is ours again! I wish that you could join our clan for good.\n\n'Trum Dreng would be so much safer if you were here.'
'Try banging on the door and see if Murig comes down. He might think it is his own kin making the commotion.'
Murig has settled at the watch-tower of Trum Dreng. If this waypoint is to be secured, he must be called down and defeated so that the Stag-clan can reclaim it.
Murig has been driven off once again
Bang on the door to the watch-tower to summon Murig
Murig can be found at the watch-tower in Trum Dreng.\n\nYou should bang on the door to see if Murig will be foolish enough to come down from his eyrie.
Return to Elain on the path to the watch-tower

Elain can be found on the hill that leads to the watch-tower, defending against approaching Dragon-clansmen in the plains.\n\nYou should return to Elain and tell her that the watch-tower has been reclaimed for the Stag-clan.
